column4: How can I set the top panel (menubar) to be transparent?  (compiz config is not an option - doesn't work with unity)
are you sure the compiz config not work? It works in my case.
I just installed it and tried to change sth and it completely f#cked up my desktop. Had to spend 20min searching for a solution on the web to restore it.
it there, in the unity plugin config, the experience tab, panel opacity
as I just said, CompizConfig is dangerous and I uninstalled it and will never touch it again, until it's fixed thoroughly to work with Unity.
compiz config works as a charm on my laptop, as long as you dont mess up so much :D
the command way is dangerous too, it just depends on who is using it...
yes, you can do the equivalent of "format c:\" in command line, but that's proactive danger.

dr_willis, actually all I did in CompizConfig was go to the "About" section to see the version number. And it completely messed up my Compiz and Unity. Here's a testimony of what happens: http://askubuntu.com/questions/70866/how-to-reset-compiz-unity-to-defaults
AFAIK, compiz config is the easiest tool to config unity, as long as you dont set up any other plugins
I was using the default installation and didn't really have the chance to go to any plugin config. It's just very buggy and dangerous with Unity.
then, maybe you should install gconf-editor tool, this tool is very dagerous too, but I prefer it to the gconftool command
I think the key you should change is at /apps/compiz-1/plugins/unityshell/screen0/options/panel_opacity
I have gconf-editor, use it and it never ever failed me.
thank you! That is precisely what I needed!  :) :) :)
